clusters.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill dozens after record rainfall
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazil Floods Kill Dozens After Record Rainfall

items.title: Brazil floods and landslides kill dozens after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed at least 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.
items.content: Three firefighters recovered a man’s body from mud and rubble after landslides triggered by torrential rains killed at least 30 people in southeastern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday, with 39 still missing. Rivers burst their banks in Minas Gerais state, inundating Juiz de Fora and Uba. More than 200 people were rescued.

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 30 after record rainfall
items.standfirst: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...
items.content: Firefighters search for 39 people missing in debris after river burst and houses were swept awayThree firefighters pulled a man’s body from the mud amid the rubble of houses swept away in a landslide in south-eastern Brazil, where 30 people died and 39 were still missing on Tuesday after torrential rains.A river in the state of Minas Gerais burst its banks and streets became raging currents of brown water after an overnight downpour in a region that has seen record rain this month. Continue reading...

items.title: Floods and landslides in Brazil kill at least 25
items.standfirst: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.
items.content: Hundreds of people have been displaced and dozens are missing, with rescue operations still ongoing in Juiz de Fora.

items.title: At least 23 dead as heavy rains unleash floods in southeastern Brazil
items.standfirst: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.
items.content: Search and rescue workers are looking for more than 40 people who remain missing as towns reel from torrential rainfall.

ai_summary: At least 30 people killed in southeastern Brazil

clusters.title: Champions League: Bodo/Glimt make history by eliminating Inter
clusters.neutral_headline: Bodo Glimt Make History In Champions League

items.title: Champions League: Bodo/Glimt make history by eliminating Inter
items.standfirst: Bodo/Glimt made history by knocking 2025 finalist Inter Milan out of Champions League.
items.content: Bodo/Glimt made history by knocking 2025 finalist Inter Milan out of Champions League.

items.title: 'Historical moment' as Norway's Bodo/Glimt succeed against all odds
items.standfirst: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.
items.content: Bodo/Glimt knock out last year's finalists Inter Milan in one of the biggest upsets in Champions League history and now the team from the Arctic Circle is dreaming of how far they can go after reaching last 16.

items.title: Bodo/Glimt complete dream run with victory over Inter Milan in Champions League
items.standfirst: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.
items.content: Norwegian side Bodo/Glimt reached the Champions League last 16 on Tuesday after a 2-1 win at Inter Milan secured a 5-2 aggregate victory, sealing the biggest result in the club’s history and setting up a tie with either Manchester City or Sporting Portugal.

clusters.title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
clusters.neutral_headline: Japan To Deploy Missiles Near Taiwan

items.title: Japan to deploy missiles on island near Taiwan by 2031
items.standfirst: The remote Yonaguni island lies on the frontlines of self-governing Taiwan's growing tensions with China.
items.content: The remote Yonaguni island lies on the frontlines of self-governing Taiwan's growing tensions with China.

items.title: Japan to deploy missiles to island near Taiwan by 2031, says defence minister
items.standfirst: Surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni, Japan’s westernmost islandJapan will deploy missiles to a tiny island near Taiwan within five years, its defence minister has said, in a move that is likely to inflame tensions with China.The surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni – Japan’s westernmost island – by March 2031, Shinjiro Koizumi said. Continue reading...
items.content: Surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni, Japan’s westernmost islandJapan will deploy missiles to a tiny island near Taiwan within five years, its defence minister has said, in a move that is likely to inflame tensions with China.The surface-to-air missiles, which are capable of shooting down aircraft and ballistic missiles, will be located on Yonaguni – Japan’s westernmost island – by March 2031, Shinjiro Koizumi said. clusters.title: Iran’s FM says deal with US ‘within reach’; Trump says he prefers diplomacy
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran Says Deal With US Within Reach

items.title: Iran’s FM says deal with US ‘within reach’; Trump says he prefers diplomacy
items.standfirst: Foreign Minister Araghchi's remarks ahead of Geneva talks come as second US aircraft carrier heads towards Middle East.
items.content: Foreign Minister Araghchi's remarks ahead of Geneva talks come as second US aircraft carrier heads towards Middle East.

items.title: Iran says deal with US 'within reach' ahead of talks in Geneva
items.standfirst: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Tuesday a deal to avert military confrontation with the United States was within reach, ahead of talks set to resume in Geneva. His remarks came as Tehran issued a muted warning to student protesters amid mounting US threats over Iran’s nuclear programme.
items.content: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said Tuesday a deal to avert military confrontation with the United States was within reach, ahead of talks set to resume in Geneva. His remarks came as Tehran issued a muted warning to student protesters amid mounting US threats over Iran’s nuclear programme.

clusters.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
clusters.neutral_headline: South Africa Secures Release Of Nationals

items.title: South Africa secures release of more nationals lured to Ukraine war
items.standfirst: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.
items.content: In tonight's edition, President Cyril Ramaphosa thanks his counterpart Vladimir Putin for helping to secure the return of 11 South Africans tricked into joining the Russia-Ukraine war. Also, the military spokesperson for the M23 rebel group is reportedly killed in an army drone strike in eastern DR Congo. And more than 6 million people are on the brink of famine in Somalia as the country is facing widespread drought.

items.title: Ramaphosa thanks Putin for release of South Africans lured into Russia-Ukraine war
items.standfirst: The men believed they were going to Russia for training as bodyguards but ended up on the front line.
items.content: The men believed they were going to Russia for training as bodyguards but ended up on the front line.

The cartel responded with a wave of retaliatory attacks that included highway blockades, prison…

items.title: Mexico pledges safety for World Cup after violence erupts from cartel boss’s killing
items.standfirst: Mexico’s president says there is ‘no risk’ for those visiting for Fifa games after military killed drug lord ‘El Mencho’Violence in Mexico after military kills notorious drug cartel boss – a visual guideMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has said that there is “no risk” for visitors coming to Fifa World Cup games scheduled to be held in the country, after the death of a top cartel boss triggered a wave of retaliatory violence from gunmen who blocked roads and attacked security forces across the country.The Mexican military attempted to detain “El Mencho”, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, in a dawn raid on Sunday, leading to a firefight in which he was fatally wounded, before dying while being airlifted to hospital. Continue reading...
items.content: Mexico’s president says there is ‘no risk’ for those visiting for Fifa games after military killed drug lord ‘El Mencho’Violence in Mexico after military kills notorious drug cartel boss – a visual guideMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has said that there is “no risk” for visitors coming to Fifa World Cup games scheduled to be held in the country, after the death of a top cartel boss triggered a wave of retaliatory violence from gunmen who blocked roads and attacked security forces across the country.The Mexican military attempted to detain “El Mencho”, the leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, in a dawn raid on Sunday, leading to a firefight in which he was fatally wounded, before dying while being airlifted to hospital. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
clusters.neutral_headline: US Envoy Pledges Not To Interfere In France

items.title: Paris says US envoy pledges not to 'interfere' in France affairs
items.standfirst: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.
items.content: The US ambassador to Paris, Charles Kushner, called France's foreign minister Tuesday and pledged not to "interfere" in the host country's affairs, a diplomatic source said, after a fallout over Washington's remarks following the killing of a far-right activist. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.

items.title: US ambassador to France set for talks with foreign minister after row
items.standfirst: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.
items.content: Charles Kushner has spoken to France's foreign minister after failing to respond to a summons on Monday.

clusters.title: Louvre museum director resigns months after high-profile heist

items.title: Louvre museum director resigns months after high-profile heist
items.standfirst: Laurence des Carrs submitted her resignation to President Emmanel Macron, who said it was "an act of responsibility".
items.content: Laurence des Carrs submitted her resignation to President Emmanel Macron, who said it was "an act of responsibility".

items.title: Louvre president resigns as jewellery heist inquiry reveals ‘systemic failures’
items.standfirst: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...
items.content: Laurence des Cars steps down days after parliamentary inquiry called Paris museum a ‘state within a state’The president of the Louvre in Paris has resigned, four months after a gang of thieves broke into the museum’s Apollo gallery and made off with €88m (£76m) of Napoleonic jewellery in France’s most dramatic heist in decades.Laurence des Cars, who had offered to step down in the immediate aftermath of the burglary, tendered her resignation to Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday in what the French president called “an act of responsibility”, the Elysée Palace said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Louvre museum director Laurence des Cars resigns
Resignation follows high profile jewelry heist
Investigation reveals systemic failures at museum
Director takes responsibility for security lapses
New leadership to address security concerns

items.title: Video shows compound where Mexican cartel leader was killed
items.standfirst: New video shows the inside of the compound in Tapalpa, Mexico, where authorities located and killed drug cartel leader Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho." NBC News’ George Solis reports on the state of the country amid the violence carried out by cartel members furious over the killing.
items.content: New video shows the inside of the compound in Tapalpa, Mexico, where authorities located and killed drug cartel leader Nemesio Rubén Oseguera Cervantes, also known as "El Mencho."
